text: this is a historic site but it's also a
big tourist attraction and yesterday
being a Saturday in the middle of peak
tourist season here there were hundreds
of people on the stairs of the star
inside the tower as well when that
massive earthquake occurred scores of
bodies have been pulled out of this
rubble but even as I stand here there is
a distinct smell of dead bodies and the
fear really is not over yet just as we
were walking here to this tower there
was a big aftershock it went on for
about ten seconds you felt like you were
being thrown off even when you were just
walking on an empty road people panicked
they ran helter skelter that's why most
people haven't gone indoors at all since
yesterday because there have been scores
of aftershocks as well in fact driving
here all the way across Kathmandu we've
seen people out in the open there's a
big park not far from here which looks
actually like a campsite because there
are tents all over it family sitting
under there too scared still to go home
